title: Great Airport Transfers
text: We used them for airport transfers to & from our hotel without the sightseeing tour, and was pleased with the service. Our driver, John, drove us for both transfers and he was very pleasant & on time. He offered us bottled water and had hand sanitizer for us to use on both trips. He gave us an overview of Athens and gave recommendations when asked. Highly recommend
place: Athens Private Airport Transfer with 1 hour Sightseeing

title: Great Museum
text: It's a must stopover after visiting the Acropolis on the hill. This is where the collection of the artifacts are kept to preserve them for future generations. An excellent display of the history of ancient Athens. I liked that the layout of the 3rd floor is an exact replica of the Parthenon building.
place: Skip the Line: Athens New Acropolis Museum Ticket

title: Must visit
text: Great area to wander around to shop, eat, drink, and take in vibe. Nice quaint shops on narrow streets, all with the Acropolis in the background.

title: Majestic
text: The city on top of the hill is more than just the Parthenon. There are numerous ruins of structures and architectural wonders to see. Just the walk up the hill, makes you appreciate the enormity of the construction process that took place here over 1000 years ago. How did they do it??

title: #1 Site in Athens
text: How is this the #2 site??? People come from all over the world to see this. It was built on top of a hill over 1000 years ago so people could see it out at sea and afar. This place was always meant to be the #1 site in Athens. I was happy that I got the opportunity to see this architectural marvel in person. I cannot image anyone going to Athens and not taking time to stop here.

title: So much Food
text:
I think this was the first time in my life that I never ate all my french fries!!!
To be fair, we weren't extremely hungry, when we entered but it was 8pm and wanted to eat something before drinking. We ordered greek salads, an eggplant appetizer, and gyros. The volume of food that came out of that kitchen and onto our tables was astounding. The pricetag for that food would have been at least double in NY. The eggplant app must have been 2 whole eggplants cut up & fried. The gyro platter could not fit on a normal plate, so it was placed in front of me on a round silver pizza platter. Must of been over 1.lb of fries. It was all delicious & very reasonably priced.

title: Greek Diner
text: Postscript or PS, it's the same restaurant. The least expensive meal we had in Greece. And it was great. It reminded me of the Greek Diners in NY. The menu looked the same way. We tried a Greek pizza, a greek salad, and Haloumi, which is a greek grilled cheese (no bread) appetizer, delicious!! Their pizza is not like NY, but for where we were, it was good enough, we enjoyed it.

title: Greek Diner
text: Postscript or PS, it's the same restaurant. The least expensive meal we had in Greece. And it was great. It reminded me of the Greek Diners in NY. The menu looked the same way. We tried a Greek pizza, a greek salad, and Haloumi, which is a greek grilled cheese (no bread) appetizer, delicious!! Their pizza is not like NY, but for where we were, it was good enough, we enjoyed it.

title: Great Restaurant
text: This restaurant was close to our hotel, and we wanted to try it as soon as we saw it. We were pleased. I ordered the steak and my wife ordered the shrimp. With the exception of my wife's reaction to the heads of the shrimp still being attached, both meals were great. We also had greek salads and a mushroom appetizer, which were both delicious. Highly recommend

title: Very Good Hotel
text: Overall I thought the Stanley was a very good hotel. I was dismayed that the rooftop bar/restaurant was closed, because there was no prior posting of the construction, when we booked. But it did have another restaurant and room service. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast which was very good with many greek & american food items to choose from. The rooms were clean, and the Metro station was right on the corner. There were many food choices & restaurants in the immediate area, which we ate at a different one each nite. Some reviews questioned the safeness of the are, and that was not my experience. I feel those people are not used to urban settings. It was a densely populated traffic area but not a criminal element one. The only thing to be aware of is the traffic. Lots of small cars & motorcycles racing around the traffic circle with little regard to traffic rules(red lights) made crossing the streets an interesting challenge. But once across the intersection I had no worries.

title: Great Stop at the end of the Day
text: This place is right next door to our hotel, so we stopped here every night before retiring to treat ourselves. It is open 24 hours. We only tried the pastries/desserts, so I can't comment on any of their other food, but it all looked delicious, which all the pastries were. Black Forest cake, Tiramisu, Chocolate Eclairs, Opera Cake (greek tiramisu),Fruit Tart Cake, & a variety of Cheesecakes and cookies, we tried them all and they were all great. Some previous reviews stated the staff were rude, we didn't experience that, but I think I know why people feel that way. In the food industry in the USA, they work for tips & give a little extra attention/smile to cater to the consumer. In Europe, they don't give you that fake smile, but they still do their job. Every time I entered the BF, someone was helping within 5 minutes, they didn't smile or make suggestions, but they waited patiently until I made my decision. I'm good with that.

title: "Coffin" Inn
text: There are many positive aspects for this hotel, but the MAIN drawback is the size of the rooms & the narrow hallways. First the positives, the staff was very helpful & accommodating. The hotel was very clean from the rooms, dining area, reception & halls. The continental breakfast, which is included, was a great way to start the day. Great location, near the Tube, and at a great price. Now the rooms. I read the reviews & stayed in European hotels before; so I know or thought I knew what to expect, especially since the "Comfort Inn" brand name is so widely known in the USA to have a certain level of comfortableness.. If we stayed only a nite, it would have sufficed, however we stayed for a week, and all I could think of "what if" a fire or some other disaster would have occurred. All would be lost. There is only 1 way in & 1 way out, and the hallways were so narrow that a 'bloke' with wide shoulders would have to walk sideways to get to his room. Hopefully no one would be walking in the opposite direction. No fire exits/escapes above the ground floor. We had 5 persons and stayed in 3 doublebed rooms. All were the same. There was a small cubby to put some clothes items. It was the size of a school locker. I let my wife use it, so I had to live out of my suitcase for a week. But there is no place to put the suitcase, so I had to leave it in the walking path and step over it when getting in & out of bed. The bathrooms were small too, there was no room to move in the entire rooms or hotel. I would advise anyone who is considering staying here to really consider the duration of your stay, and pay extra for the larger rooms. And hope a fire doesn't occur.

title: First Indoor Shopping Mall
text: On our tour, we were given the history of this beautiful shopping center. An indoor shopping area with a ceiling that allows natural light was remarkable achievement over 100 years ago. Today, the high end shops, cafes, chocolate vendors cater to tourists. A must visit

title: Beautiful Square
text: During the day you can appreciate the different architecture designs on all 4 sides of the square, and at night it is beautiful with the lights. We took a tour, which taught us the history of the square and the architecture influences of the buildings, which is representative of all of Europe. Easy to see why this is the number 1 attraction of Brussels.

title: Definitively an "All in 1" tour
text:
Was that a tourist tour or did we attend a college seminar on Brussels/Belgium history, culture, cuisine, art, architecture,..etc? We came into Brussels for a day trip from London, and wanted to get the most of our short stay. Well we got what we paid for.
Avo was amazing, and the information was at times overwhelming. I came to Brussels thinking what a quaint beautiful city, and upon departure, falling in love with Brussels & wanting to return. Avo walked us around the city, stopping frequently to tell us about Brussels' history..etc.. We gave us an education on chocolate tasting, beer tasting, waffles and showed us the tourist hot 'spots' & the hidden 'spots' down Brussels' alleyways, which we never would have discovered on our own. We experienced too much to list in this review, which is a testament of how much this tour offers. Highly recommend this tour if you have the time as it does take 5.5-6 hours.
One tip, do not add a 'mixer' to the whisky portion of the tour. We had 4 women in our group who do not drink it straight, when they did, I believe it upset Avo. Sorry.
place: Brussels Chocolate Beer Waffle and Belgian Whiskey All-in-One Tour

title: Excellent Service
text: We utilized 'London Travel In' for our airport transfers between LHR and our Hyde Park Hotel. The driver was waiting for us upon arrival, asked us if we needed any assistance or we had any questions since we were 'first timers' in London. He was very helpful. On the date of departure, we called their customer service line and requested if the driver could come earlier than requested. They were very accommodating and again we had a pleasant drive back to LHR. Definitely recommend and would use them again if travelling back to London.
place: Private Round Trip Transfer between London Airports and Hotel

title: Lantern Tour
text: Unfortunately the elevators were out; so we couldn't do the main tours that were usually offered. However, we visited the Visitor Center and took the Lantern Tour. The Visitor Center was very informative, and prepared us for the lantern tour. We had to drive a mile down the road to begin the tour, but it was worth it. The tour itself was great. After a short hike we entered the cave, and our tour guide locked us in by securing a metal gate across the entrance with a lock. Not initially understanding as to why he was doing that, he explained that not only did that prevent any animals wandering in while we were inside, it also prevented people from leaving without first disinfecting their shoes. The tour led us underground utilizing very narrow staircases and having to 'duck' down while walking beneath rock ledges. The only light down there was from the lanterns which we were carrying. It was a great tour.

title: Fantastic Drive
text: I knew when I started the trip that it was gonna be a good drive, but it was more than that. A one way narrow dirt road that hugs the mountain with sheer drop-offs was a great adrenaline rush to see spectacular views. Along the way, we saw elk and other small wildlife along with waterfalls & beautiful scenery. Trail Ridge Road was great also for the ride back, but everyone travelling to the Alpine Visitor Center should take Old Fall River Road on the way up , if you can.

title: Great Lunch
text: We stopped here during our stay in Estes Park just to visit the Hotel which inspired Stephen King, but we stayed for lunch anyway. We were not disappointed. Even though we thought it was a little bit expensive, the steak and salad entrees were delicious. The hotel and grounds are worth a visit, and while you're there stop in the restaurant. However, I don't know if I would go out of my way and return a second time, if I wasn't going to stay there.
place: Cascades Restaurant at the Stanley Hotel

title: Like Home
text: Stopped here because we needed something to eat and it was next to our Motel. We didn't plan on eating pizza when we were on vacation but we got back late one night and just wanted to stay in our room. I walked over to the parlor, and spoke with the owner, who is from NY. Not only did I order the pizza but he assured me that their desserts were worthy of NY tastebuds. He was right, the pizza reminded me of home, and the cannolis and tiramisu were fantastic. Excellent choice

title: First Stop
text: Great way to begin your trip by stopping here and gathering reference material, and knowledge of the area from locals.

title: A nice walk
text: We enjoyed this walk walk after visiting the Estes park Visitor Center. There were locals fishing in the river and of course you are surrounded by the beautiful scenery.

title: Great ride to Estes Park
text: We drove this longer route from the Denver Airport to our Estes Park Motel to soak in the sights. It was worth it. The scenery and the towns along the way made the trip worth it.

title: Very Good Motel near RMNP
text: This Motel does have a lot of amenities to offer; however some are dated. The hot tub was very large but it and the room needs a little TLC. When we visited the motel, it was not very busy; however they kept putting the clients together. In our section, there were about 15 units, and we were assigned a unit right next to another couple at the very end of the section.. However, the rest of our section was empty. When that couple checked out the next day, another couple checked in and was given the same unit, when the entire section was empty. A little privacy would have been appreciated, Other than that, the free breakfast was good, and the staff was very accommodating. I would stay here again.

title: A Masterpiece
text: We visited the cathedral without knowing it's indepth history. But after having a tour and learning about the architecture & history, I was in awe. It's a shame that a fire destroyed much of it one week after we visited, but I'm sure it will be restored to it's grandeur.

title: Birthday Dinner @ Eiffel, What more!!
text: I booked a dinner here for my wife's 50th birthday & was very pleased. The ambiance & the views were great. The service was great. The food was very fine dining & not what I am used to. So it was more about the presentation than the quantity. Duck pate was not my favorite but at least I can say I tried it. The veal chops were tasty. The main reason we were there was the location. It is a one time experience for us. We had a great birthday dinner celebration, but if I return to Paris, I don't think I would do it again.

title: A good starting point
text: We stayed here during our trip to Paris, and enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was included & was a great way to start the day. A 7 minute walk to the train was perfect. 3 stops to the Catacombs & 6 stops to Notre Dame. There were restaurants & a mall in the immediate area, but we didn't explore much. We just stayed here for the price & close proximity to the train.

title: Not what I expected
text: We traded our timeshare to stay at The WELK resort & expected a top notch experience. Boy were we wrong. We reserved an A unit over 6 months in advance but when we checked in they gave us a B unit, which is smaller. We protested & showed them the confirmation, but no avail. They blamed RCI & RCI blamed them. We were stuck with the B unit. When we went inside, it was dirty, not even cleaned. The kitchen sink backed up because the garbage disposal was clogged. Maintenance had to be called. The bed in the bedroom had a lopsided mattress. Midweek, we heard housecleaning outside the door & thought they we making the rounds. When I told them we would be out of their way in a minute, they informed us that our unit was not even scheduled to be cleaned. That was quickly addressed. For us the best part of the resort, was the adult pool. The other pools were kaos with screaming kids. We were able to relax & enjoy the surroundings there. We are not golf players; and that is a big part of the resort. It was a short drive to downtown Escondido, and not too far from San Diego, where we made several day trips. But I expected much better service from a Welk Resort.

title: Need more room
text: We (5) took an international economy flight from Newark to Rome with a stopover in Zurich. The staff, food & beverage were top notch. However, the room for 4 seats in the same row(middle) had minimal room. Barely enough to eat the meals, and not enough to get slightly comfortable on a flight for over 7 hours. We were lucky enough that we were together & knew each other, but we could see & hear the frustrations of other passengers in nearby rows. We were packed in like sardines.

title: Beautiful Plaza
text: Stopped here at the end of our walking tour. Great place to rest & take in all in. We had gelato at one of the cafes, and sat in the piazza to marvel at it's beauty. Loved the Egyptian obelisk in the center.

title: Tourist madhouse
text: We heard this place was a tourist mecca, so we decided to stop by later in the day hoping the crowds would dwindle. But they did not. This was still packed at night. But we got down to the edge & threw our coins in over our shoulders as the tradition goes. Have to stop by and it, beautiful fountain.

title: The first Superdome stadium
text: Just being inside and trying to imagine this structure back in it's heyday, is mind blowing. Definitely do the underground & panoramic tours if you are a history buff. It gives you a better perspective.

title: Beautiful Ancient Structure
text: Just being inside and sitting under this dome structure where 2 thousand years ago, people were doing the same thing was fantastic. If you're a fan of ancient history this is a must see.

title: Great start for Rome trip
text:
Leonardo was very accommodating. We indicated that we did not want to
walk to the Transverse on our 90 min kick start tour because it
would've ended too far from hotel, he said no problem. Another guide
told us no. Her loss. Leonardo gave us insight of Rome's past as well
as Rome's current status. He took us to secluded neighborhoods,
churches, Campo die Fiore, towards Piazza Navano. Thoroughly enjoyed
our tour. Highly recommend Leonardo

title: Worry Free Airport Transfers
text: We used Stefanos Rome Cabs for our airport transfers from FCO to our hotel. What an excellent service. Very professional. Driver was waiting for us upon exit of baggage claim area. He was very friendly and offered us advice & tips for our stay in Rome. He also pointed out important places on our trip to our hotel. On the day of departure,the driver was early, and very professional. They made the airport transfer process "worry free" Highly recommend & would definitely use this service again.

title: Very Good Resturant
text: The wife & I chose Silvio's because of the Groupon offered & we were pleased with our dining experience. We sat inside because it was humid on that day; however, the outside seating looked very inviting & on a better day it would have been the preferred choice. My favorite dish was the calamari with General Tao's sauce. I originally decided to have it with marinara sauce; however, the waitress convinced us to try it. Glad we did. Our meals were very good. The only complaint was that the busgirl burnt our bread. She seemed new at the job & we all make mistakes.

title: Excellent Restaurant Experience
text: I was a little hesitant to try this restaurant, because I knew it was nothing like the Delmonico's of Wall Street. But we were in the Albany area & wanted something a little different. First of all, the place has excellent decor. Very Italian themed with a Frank Sinatra room(table). We wanted to try everything apps, salad,dinner & dessert. The waitress warned us the the portions were large & she was right. We had the Utica Greens & portabella mushroom parmigiana apps. Excellent. My wife could've stopped there; she was already full. I had a salad & we both had chicken pasta dinners. WE couldn't fit in dessert & my wife took half her meal home. The food was excellent. Next time in Albany, I WILL stop in & try the 24oz rib eye.

title: OK for a night
text: We stayed here because our daughter is attending SUNY Albany & this is right across the street. It was obvious that people reside there, because in the morning people were coming to the coffee station with their personal coffee mugs & bathrobes on. The room was barely cleaned & 1 drawer still had someone's clothes still in it. That freaked my wife a little. The good side is that it was very spacious with a kitchenette.

title: A very long tour
text: We did the LA city, Movie homes. Downtown, & Beach tour, which was 6.5 hour long. However with traffic it took 7.5 hours. If you are only in LA for a short time & want to see as much as possible then is is a good fit. We saw Hollywood, Santa Monica, Venice Beach, Beverly Hills Downtown LA & all points in between. It was very good tour, but I would exclude the Downtown portion, to give more time at the other areas. We spent too much time in traffic going to LA Downtown, and by the time we got there the shops were closing up.

title: Great Motel
text: We were only having a short stay in the LA area & after reading the reviews decided to give the Seaside a try. Glad we did. Not much parking, but that would the only complaint. A very spacious, clean room. The motel is family run & they were very accommodating. They were giving recommendations of area & offered to move our car if we had to park in the street. They took pride in the business.

title: L.A City, Hollywood Stars’ Homes & Beach Tour
text: This is a long tour, 6.5 hr plus an extra hour for traffic. If you don't have alot of time in LA & want a taste of the city, then this is it. We hit Hollywood, the hills, Venice Beach, Santa Monica, Downtown, & everything in between. We only had 2 days so was great for us. Don't expect to spend too much time in any 1 place or go swimming, this is just to get see as much as you can. Can't give 5 stars, because of the traffic, we got to the downtown (old LA) section late & all the shops were closing. I think if they cut off the downtown portion & spent more time at the other locations then this would be a 5 star tour.

title: FRIENDS set was worth it
text: For me I would have liked if the guide talked more about the older Warner Bros movies that were made here. Instead he kept to current or recently cancelled TV shows. He seemed to be an expert on the Gilmore girls, which only 1 person in our group knew anything about them. But my teenage daughters love Friends & were able to take part in a Friends skit, which excited them. This made my day. The prop house, Batman vehicles & Justice League stop were nice.

title: Great for the curious explorer
text: I knew Tijuana is really not my type of town, but when I was visiting S.D., I had to check it out. I didn't want to pay alot for a tour & nor did I want walk around with just a map. This was the perfect tour. Fernando was an excellent guide. He knew alot of the history of the people & different parts of Mexico. He took us to the cultural center, to the shopping district & best of all Tacos. We ate before coming, but he assured us that we never had Tacos so good. He was right. I tried the pork & beef tacos & they were the best I have ever eaten. The day before I visited Old Town in SD & had what I thought were authentic Mexican Tacos. I was wrong. Best part of the trip. The only complaint I had was when we were visiting the markets. He gave us time to shop on our own, which was fine when shopping for souvenirs. However in the food market, I would have liked a guide to show us the different foods. We were walking around aimlessly in a foreign country, not knowing what we were looking at. I saw another group in the food market & their guide was with them explaining all the different foods & making recommendations of what to try. Other than that, I highly recommend the walking tour.

title: Nice Park
text: This is a must do when in SD. Beautiful park & grounds. Alot of museums. I was a little disappointed in the Air & Space museum. I thought it was a bit small. After visiting the one in Wash DC, I don't any can compare though. A lot of homeless in the area but that's all around SD. Free parking was great

title: Nice place to get a bite to Eat
text: We were visiting friends nearby & we all decided to go out to eat. There wasn't much of a selection for a sit down dining experience; so we chose Carini. Our meals were very tasty. We ordered a stromboli, buffalo wings, mercato salads,and Tortalini soups. It wasn't a fancy dining establishment, but we weren't looking for that either. My only complaint was their unsweetened iced tea, which I always order. I don't know how you can mess that up, but that was the worst iced tea I ever had.

title: Great Food; Lousy service
text: Our second time dining at Gilligan's & the same experience 'Great seafood; Lousy service'. First the food, always get the single lobster dish. The calamari appetizer was excellent. While there was only 3 clams in the lobster pot, it was loaded with mussels & a whole lobster. The best p[art is the juice at the bottom of the bowl to be eaten with bread. Now the service. As luck would have it we got Karen again, who is pleasant 'enough' but she is disinterested & could care less if you have a good experience there or not. Her friends were seated at a table next to us & she sat down with them & chatted away while we waited for drinks, bread..etc. She said they were short on busboys but the busboys weren't the problem. Maybe because there were 9 of us & the tip was added to the bill already; so she felt she didn't have to try. I hope the management reads this because this is the second time. But the food is great & reasonably priced.

title: Boston's Tourist Mecca
text: Currently this is #61 on the 'Things to do List' in Boston & I can't believe that. This location is a great place for history, street performers, shopping, & food. It's the one destination that everyone visits when they come to Boston, even if the visit is for just one day. There is always something going on any day of the year here. Maybe not #1 but certainly better than #61.

title: Great Flight
text:
This was an enjoyable flight with Jetblue. There was a delay because of storms down south; however, I was notified immediately because I signed up for their alerts on my phone. Entertainment, snacks, & drinks were good. However, for the last couple flights with them; they are always requesting passengers to check their carry-ons. And most people do not want to do it. This causes delay & stress when boarding.
If a passenger doesn't have a checked bag waiting at baggage claim; then checking a carry-on would be an added inconvenience.
Just announce that ALL passengers will have to place their carry-on bags in the "measurement display" at the gate WHILE boarding. If it doesn't fit they will be charged, or they can voluntary check it for free BEFOREHAND at the gate.
Then MAKE everyone place their bag in that "measurement display". The size of bags people carry-on is ridiculous nowadays

title: Not for the "Mature" crowd
text: If I were in my twenties & here with my buddies this would've been paradise. Eat. Drink & all the craziness...I would've been sleeping on the streets with the bums. But alas, that would've been over 25 years ago, and I'm not the same person. I came to N.O. for the jazz music, history, vibe, food, & yes some drinking. I found that over at Frenchmen Street. Bourbon St. is 'party central' and that's not a bad thing. It's all about what you're looking for. I did enjoy the Music Park at Cafe Beginet on Bourbon St. They had some nice jazz bands & an open courtyard to hang out.

title: Free Drinks???
text: I'm not a big gambler, mostly play the slots or the video poker at the bar. Every once in a blue moon I'll try my luck at Blackjack. But to me the trade off of donating my hard earned money to the casino is to get free drinks in return. When my party decided to go to Harrahs, I sat down at the slots, put in my Total Rewards card, started to play & requested my 1st drink via the machine. The waitress came and requested $$, and informed me that the slots are 50% off for drinks. You can only get free drinks at the tables. The staff was friendly & helpful. The casino was clean with lots of slots/tables. But for me 50% was a cheap policy. I convinced my party to leave after a short stay.

title: Ok for a night
text: We used the hotel for a night's stay while waiting to take a flight out of Logan airport. It was on Priceline's Secret Deal. The room was clean. Check in & out was easy. There wasn't much else for this hotel to offer, but as I stated we were just crashing for the night. There were places to eat in the vicinity of the hotel, which is located on a very busy commercial street.

title: Sad, Sad, Sad
text: We went to Dick's 4 years ago & had a good time. So when we returned to Boston, we brought our sister in law to the restaurant in an attempt to experience the same. This place has gone down hill. On our first visit, the waiters made the experience to be fun. Yes, they were a little rude, but it was apparent they were acting. They knew how to turn it on & off. This time they were nasty, and when I left I wished I went somewhere else. The food also was lacking. The fried pickles were loaded with salt. The 'loaded' nachos were just tortilla chips with 2 cents worth of chili & cheese. More than half of the chips were plain. Go somewhere else

title: The tourist thing to do
text: We knew this wasn't the actual bar from the TV show, but we felt we had to stop for a drink. I'm glad we did. They have cut-outs of the characters so you can take tourist photos, and the bar is a smaller replica of the actual TV set. They bartenders were great & they have some very good IPAs on tap. We didn't eat there; so I can't comment on the food. If you're an out of town tourist & a fan of the show, gotta do it.

title: American History
text: This is part of the Freedom Trail. I'm a history buff; so I really like these places. To think that the birth of our country took place in cities like Boston & this site played a part is interesting to me. That said, I saw I a lot of cranky toddlers, kids & fed-up parents; so.......know what you're taking your family to. Kids see it as a boring museum. There's no rides.

title: Great Location, Great Staff
text: I stayed at the W.F.Q. as part of a package deal offered by Jetblue & couldn't have been happier. It was a great location being 1 block from Bourbon St; so after dealing with the crazies, you could walk off to peace. Also being 1 block from Canal St, meant close access to the trolleys. The staff was great, they always had a cheerful disposition & they held our bags both times at check in/out in a secure location. They had a decent pool at the 10th floor, which closed at 11pm. If I had 1 complaint, it would be to impose an adults only swim time after 9pm.

title: Excellent Tour
text: We choose the 3 in 1 Cemetery, Voodoo, History tour. It was great tour that covered a little bit of everything. Visiting St Louis Cemetery & the Groupon discount were the main reasons for choosing this tour. We ended the tour in Louis Armstrong park, which was nice since we didn't include that in our vacation plans.

title: Excellent Museum; Crowded
text: Loved the Museum. Excellent artifacts. Every aspect of WW2 was explored. Loved the personal viewpoints of the military personnel. Negatives it was crowded. We went on a Thursday & it was still a madhouse. The different sections had themes ie: in the Pacific section you felt like you were walking through a jungle, however with the crowds & the baby strollers & double strollers(why), it was hard to read & see everything. I did like the Dog Tag experience, where you follow one soldier/sailor's story throughout museum; however, I knew once they asked for your email, the nonsense emails would begin as soon as you leave & the days/weeks to come.

title: Better than Bourbon Street
text: This is what I expected New Orleans to be like. Everyone drinking, music playing from almost every establishment, some shops with items to sell, street performers & places to eat. An Adult Vacation, not a street where you can see how much one can drink & how many crazy street acts can harass you for money. Stop at Bourbon to check it out, but spend your quality time on Frenchmen Street

title: Center of it all
text: Great place to use as a beginning for all of your excursions. Right in front of St Louis Cathedral, they are bands playing, vendors selling art, statutes, & both sides flanked by 1850's buildings with stores & museums. A great vibe

title: Frugal Way to get around
text: We used Uber to get from the airport to the hotel, after that we used streetcars & buses. Very inexpensive, $3 to ride all day. Only drawback was on the St Charles line, which goes to garden district, was always behind schedule. All tourists use that line because that line has the old style cars & the destination. However, no one buys their ticket ahead of time, and each person has to put exact change into the meter. Twenty people putting 3 singles at a time takes time. At each stop. And if another trolley catches up in the meantime, it can't pass, the whole line backs up. The canal line & the riverfront line was a great way around the quarter. Also the 55 bus was great for Frenchmen St.

title: This is New Orleans
text: For us tourists, the boundaries for New Orleans is the French Quarter. I know locals would disagree, but I mean this as a compliment. Excellent architecture, vibe, food, shopping, & people. The roadways & sidewalks could use some repair. Just because a city is old, doesn't mean you don't do maintenance. I saw several people trip. But I wouldn't want to go or spend my time anywhere else in New orleans

title: Beautiful Cathedral
text: Outside & Inside, what a beautiful cathedral. Each city we visit we make sure we visit either the city's cathedral or basilica, and New Orleans main church did not disappoint. At nighttime take a walk to the rear on Royal St. They have a spotlight on the statue of Jesus, which casts a shadow on the Cathedral's walls. Very Nice.

title: Beautiful Area
text: We did a self guided tour, and we were unaware the Lafayette Cemetery closed at 3pm. Our mistake. So we after taking the St Charles street car to Washington Ave, we used to app to point out the historical houses & walked around. Had a lovely time & saw other tourists doing the same. After an hour we got back on the St Charles line & we back to the quarter.

title: 1 block from the madness
text: Royal Street is beautiful with all the shops, restaurants, some bars, & beautiful architecture. It it because the police station is on Royal St, that the craziness stops at Bourbon St

title: Very old & crowded
text: No tourist can get in without a city registered tour guide, so you would think it wouldn't be crowded, but it was. The was a line to get in, and once inside, you had to wait your turn to visit certain(famous) grave markers. Still visiting this old cemetery was worth the extra $1 admittance fee. Seeing the old mausoleums sinking into the ground, while others right next to them don't, was mind boggling.

title: Excellent Muffaletta Sandwich
text: After reading the reviews, we decided to stopped here after visiting the WW2 museum. We can't comment about anything else on the menu as all 3 of us ordered the Muffaletta Sandwich. It was AMAZING. I saw bigger Mufalleta sandwiches in the quarter and the were huge, but it appeared they were on regular roll bread. At C.B.'s the bread is the secret. It was soft, fresh, seeded roll and it was big enough for one person. Although my wife only ate 3/4s. Only gave 4 stars because we didn't try anything else.

title: Loved the O.G.
text: In almost every tourist magazine or website for New Orleans, you can find a coupon for 10% for the OG. I assumed because of this it must be mediocre food/place. I was wrong. I enjoyed my dining experience at the OG. We sat in the courtyard by the fountain, and ordered the blackened alligator, po-boy alligator & a seafood combo meal. It was all excellent but the best of all was the blackened alligator appetizer. I wasn't sure at first, but the waitress convinced me to try it, and I'm sure glad I did. My only regret is when my po-boy alligator came out, I had already ordered it fried. I wish I knew beforehand how delicious it was blackened. Also huge portions & reasonably priced.

title: Tourist Heaven
text: If your on Bourbon St, then you're there to drink. So why not stop by the oldest bar in New Orleans. But everyone has the same idea; so it is packed. Tour groups put this location on their stops & everyone tries to belly up to the bar. It's a great place with alot of history. Even if you can't get a seat at the bar, it's still worth a stop if you're a history buff like me.

title: Bacon Bloody Mary's
text: I read the reviews, and put this on the list of places to visit. When I walked in & saw the sign for Bacon Bloody Marys, I knew I had to have one. Excellent. Spicy, Strong, with pickled veggies & BACON. I wish they were bottomless like some other places do, but what can you do. Oh, and the breakfast was delicious, eggs & pancakes complimented the bloody mary well. Only criticism is the downstairs was tight for seating. A couple came in with their suitcases because they were flying out & made it even more crammed. A great breakfast place, but I would try upstairs next time

title: Great Price, Good Food
text: We went here when I attempted to get into Jimmy J's next door. That place was small & packed & there was a long line. I compared the menu prices for both places & D.D.s were much more practical for eggs & pancakes. We went to D.D.s and only had 2 people in front of us, only waited 5 minutes. I ordered their BOTTOMLESS bloody mary with a crawfish, pickled veggie garnish, delicious. I had 2 during breakfast & the waitress gave me another to go in a souvenir cup. Cannot beat that price. Also had the eggs & pancakes for breakfast. Liked it so much, we went back the next day & didn't even stop at the other place to look.

title: Bourbon Milk Shakes
text: We stayed around the corner & hit this place up right after we checked in. The food was good, I had a fried shrimp po-boy, but the best was the frozen bourbon milkshake. Even after spending a week in NO, I must say it was the favorite drink for all of us. My wife would stop in & get one in a 'togo' cup & walk around Bourbon St. If you're a whiskey drinker this is a must stop. I never seen an establishment with such an array of whisky/bourbon.

title: Pleasant surprise
text: We were looking for a place to eat after dropping our daughter off at college & didn't feel like eating at the normal chain restaurants. We sat down in spacious, clean booths, and had a very pleasant waitress. We ordered a the Eli chop salad & the chicken cesear. Both were huge portions & delicious. Would definitely return.

title: Great Pizza with a Smile
text: Everyone in N.Y. favors the pizzeria in the neighborhood, which you grew up in, and criticizes every other one. But when I stopped by Tina's in Chester, it was like I never left home. We grabbed slices as they just came out of the oven & it was a perfect blend of cheese & great tasting sauce. But best of all was our server, Allie, who couldn't be more helpful & accommodating. Answering all our questions & making suggestions of her favorites, all with a great smile.

title: Finally...something different
text: The thought of going to a restaurant at a mall was not pleasing. The cookie cutter/chain restaurants are the norm. But Fuji is unique. When you walk in, you feel as though you are in an authentic Japanese steakhouse. The food was great. We had sushi for appetizers & I had the Hibachi Steak for dinner. Couldn't have been better. We were seated & waited on by our server, Amanda, who was fantastic!! It was a busy nite & she had multiple tables(each table has multiple parties), and she did not miss a beat. She was attentive to our needs & answered all questions, and made the dining experience a pleasure. Definitely would return

title: Great Value...not fine dining
text: The O.G. is what it is....a chain restaurant. People think it is fine Italian cuisine & that shows how good their marketing department is. I've eaten at many OGs & Middletown is the best. Always have consistent good, friendly service, & clean dining area. The meals are reasonably priced, and how can anyone deny that unlimited salad & breadsticks is the greatest attraction of all. If anyone walks away hungry from OG, it is their own dumb fault. Try to go when they have their special "Buy 1 & take 1 home deal". Buy a meal from a limited menu & take home a meal. Can't beat that

title: Always Good......except for that 1 time
text: I & my family have flown Jetblue many times & never had a complaint. Always on time, courteous staff & ease of checking in. On our trip back from Cuba this summer we had an all day ordeal. My main complaint was the lack of communication from Jetblue to their customers. Thunderstorms in FLA shutdown Ft Lauderdale Airport so we were stuck in Havana for hours. Nothing anyone could do, but wait. However, waiting without word or information was frustrating. When we were able to fly we landed in FLA for our connecting flight to ALB., and the airport shutdown again for hours. This time not only was there a lack of information, the information that was given was false. They kept telling us "it'll only be a half-hour more or the plane is being cleaned at another gate & we have to wait". It was apparent we were being lied to. We were getting better info from their website than the representatives at the Terminal. In the absence of authority, chaos ensued. Hundreds of angry travelers yelling at the poor counter people. It's easy to give good service when everything is running OK, but the true test of professionalism is when it's one of 'those bad days' & the company can still maintain it's integrity.

title: Didn't live up to the Hype
text: We lived in OC our entire lives but had not tried Tony Bs. They have been around for a long time & we always heard good reviews. However on Xmas eve our family of 17 people went there for dinner, and it didn't impress. I know it was a busy nite, but when half of the table have to constantly get up & go to the bar for drinks, the wait staff should've took notice & corrected their service. The veal dishes were good, no complaints there. Plenty of bread. However, five of the dishes were the scallops, which was the special. Two of the five served had a smell of ammonia, which means they were old. How does a chef serve that. The waitress & manger were very pleasant & accommodating, which stopped a bad situation from becoming worse. But I'm on the fence on whether to return. Maybe it was just a fluke, or maybe they been there so long they just don't care.

title: Not as promised
text:
We were taken here after an Old Car tour, which I believe the driver got some kind of kickback, and we were told that it was one of Havana's best. Well it wasn't. The wait staff seemed annoyed that we didn't have a reservation, but there was plenty of tables. They gave us wooden bowls & cups still dripping with water. They told us that meant they were just cleaned. But their water makes us sick!! So no one drank from cups. I had the Ropa Vieja, which was good, but the rest of the meals were subpar & not as promised. We ordered the fried bananas with our meals, but they forgot them & they came with the check, which was wrong(extra items not ordered). They were pushing cigars & bar drinks on us. We don't smoke & we are not drunken sailors. One or two drinks with dinner is more our speed. The waitress got more rude as the night went on. I would not recommend this place & it wasn't even on my list on places to eat while in Havana. But I made the mistake of listening to the recommendation of my car driver. After reading the other reviews, it seems that is the scam for this place.
I hope he got a good kickback.

title: Nice stop on walking tour
text: This was one of our stops on the walking tour & it was pleasant. There were street performers, old buildings, post office & a lot of history, which our guide informed us about. We didn't go inside the church, but it was beautiful from the outside.

title: Fun Statue
text: This statue & the other street performers posing as statues adds to the fun atmosphere of the San Francisco plaza. It's funny to see all the tourists really believe that you will have good luck if you pose in a silly stance with one hand on his beard; one hand on his finger; & one foot on his foot. The Cuban who came up with that tale is laughing everyday at all the dumb tourists, who actually do it. But it all in good fun
